Article Title: Threat from AI-generated deepfakes: If all can be faked, how do you know what‚Äôs real?
Article Text:
.

Deepfake Shock: Nirmala Sitharaman Reveals Fake Videos Of Herself Online, Warns Of AI‚Äôs Dark Side

Armour up with TOI to fight deepening threat of deepfakes





In a world where seeing is no longer believing, India is facing a new digital menace: AI-generated deepfakes.These hyper-realistic videos and audio clips don‚Äôt just distort reality. They manipulate public perception, spread misinformation and undermine trust in democracy itself.With 85.5 per cent of Indian households owning at least one smartphone, mobile phones have become India‚Äôs bank, classroom and television, making citizens more vulnerable to digital deception.During the 2024 elections, for instance, satirical deepfakes became a campaign tool of sorts. Apart from resurrecting dead leaders, it featured clips such as one that featured PM Narendra Modi dancing the garba with women and Kamal Nath dissing a popular welfare scheme.Though investigations and arrests followed, such videos blur the line between fact and fiction, risking the distortion of voter opinion and the integrity of the democratic process.Cybersecurity experts warn AI is also becoming a key tool in cybercrime: 80 per cent phishing campaigns in 2024 involved AI, with deepfakes exploited for scams.‚ÄúWhen you can fake images, audio, and video, how do you know if a real video is real? Suddenly, everything is in question,‚Äù said Hany Farid, professor at the University of California, Berkeley, in a TOI interview last year about the worrying rise in AI misuse.The deepfake threat extends beyond politics. Recently, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted the misuse of AI to clone voices and produce fake videos impersonating her, warning of potential financial scams and the erosion of public trust. ‚ÄúI have seen several deepfake videos of myself being circulated online, manipulated to mislead citizens and distort facts,‚Äù Sitharaman said in Mumbai. ‚ÄúCriminals are using AI to mimic voices, clone identities, and create lifelike videos,‚Äù she added.Given that over 97% of India‚Äôs urban youth aged 15 to 29 owns a smartphone, the impact of such misinformation on a generation is worrying, say observers. ‚ÄúDeepfakes began in 2016. Back then, it was a joke. But the technology has only gotten better. Earlier, there were photoshopped face swaps. Now there are lipsync fakes,‚Äù said Prof. Farid, warning that the tech has become more refined, raising the risk of harassment of women through the use of non-consensual sexual imagery.In Nov 2023, actress Rashmika Mandanna became a victim of a viral deepfake video that superimposed her face on to compromising content, sparking widespread outrage. ‚ÄúThe very term ‚Äòdeepfake‚Äô comes from a Reddit user who in the early days of this technology used it to create porn,‚Äù said Farid, calling the new term ‚ÄòGenerative AI‚Äô clever ‚Äúrebranding‚Äù by the male-dominated tech industry.As AI evolves, India must strengthen legal frameworks, enhance digital literacy, and bring together minds across sectors to ensure safety, say experts. ‚ÄúWe need to label everything as real or not real,‚Äù said Farid, ‚ÄúWe need real disclosures.‚Äù To combat the deepening threat of deep fakes, TOI has already started armouring up. Watch out for our ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt Get Scammed‚Äô stories to stay informed and aware. After all, as Farid puts it, ‚Äúif you don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs real, how will you know what‚Äôs false‚Äù?
Article Summary: Ai-generated videos and audio clips don‚Äôt just distort reality. They manipulate public perception, spread misinformation and undermine trust in democracy itself. With 85.5 per cent of indian households owning at least one smartphone, mobile phones have become india‚Äôs bank, classroom and television.

Article Title: Stefon Diggs‚Äô partner Cardi B makes a bold statement after childbirth by transforming her baby‚Äôs umbilical cord into a gold pendant
Article Text:
(Image via Instagram: Cardi B with her baby boy)

Cardi B Debuts Newborn Son in Patriots Gear as She and Stefon Diggs Melt the Internet

Stefon Diggs‚Äô girlfriend Cardi B commemorates fourth baby‚Äôs birth with unique heart-shaped gold jewelry

Cardi B Turns Her Umbilical Cord Into GOLD!

More coverage on Cardi B and Stefon Diggs:

The placenta forms an extraordinary bond between mother and child, with the umbilical cord as their lifeline of silent conversation. When the baby arrives, the placenta follows, marking the end of this quiet connection. For nine months, mother and baby shared unspoken messages through this remarkable link, only to part with it at birth. But what if that connection could last a lifetime? That is probably the vision behind Mommy Made Encapsulation, a service that allows mothers to preserve their placenta forever. Such preservation was chosen by Cardi B , partner of New England Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs The couple recently welcomed a baby boy into their lives. Following the heartfelt tradition, she began with her third child, daughter Blossom, in October 2024, the Grammy-winning rapper chose to honor her fourth child with Diggs in November 2025 in a similar way. She entrusted Mommy Made Encapsulation to transform her pregnancy journey into cherished keepsakes, capturing the memorable moments when her baby was still growing inside her. The company crafted a heart-shaped gold pendant from the baby‚Äôs umbilical cord and turned the placenta into nourishing vitamins to support her post-partum recovery.Curious about how the gold pendant comes to life? The process begins with careful cleaning of the placenta, followed by a wash with blue dye that highlights its unique texture.After another rinse, the technician gently separates the placenta from the umbilical cord. The cord, now a striking blue, is shaped around a heart-shaped metal ring, with any extra length trimmed away. Finally, the piece is dipped in shimmering gold chrome, transforming it into a gleaming keepsake. The company describes it as a way to honor the first bond between mother and child. According to the company‚Äôs website, ‚ÄúThe umbilical cord keepsake is your baby‚Äôs umbilical cord dehydrated in the shape of a heart and then dipped in gold chrome. The end result looks and feels like metal and is the perfect way to honor the first connection you shared with your baby.‚Äù It costs $50.The ‚ÄúAM I THE DRAMA?‚Äù creator took things a step further by having her placenta turned into vitamin capsules. That‚Äôs not all. She also tried something called a Placenta Print. The process starts with cleaning the placenta and dyeing it blue to look like a tree. Then, a sheet of paper is pressed on top to make the company‚Äôs signature Placenta Print, which costs $65. Their website explains that the print is made by painting the placenta with food-grade coloring (one gets to choose the colors) and stamping it onto a 12-by-18-inch poster to create a Tree of Life painting. After the print is made, the placenta receives a fresh rinse before its transformation into capsules begins.The website explains that the Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) method is used, with careful steaming at 220 degrees F for 30 minutes to ensure safety. Bacteria and viruses cannot survive at temperatures higher than 131 degrees F. The placenta is gently steamed in specially designed steaming bags made up of heat-resistant, FDA-approved nylon, safe for cooking and free of BPA. Once steamed, the placenta is dried, ground into a fine powder, and sealed into capsules.Each placenta yields 160-180 pills, which, when taken regularly, can offer many benefits for new mothers, such as increased energy levels, reduced post-natal bleeding, lesser chance of baby blues, balanced mood and hormone levels, increased milk supply, lesser chance of post-partum depression, higher iron levels, uterus returning back to pre-pregnancy size faster, losing baby weight faster, and enhanced bonding experience with the baby. The capsules are available in a variety of flavors, including strawberry, orange, bubblegum, lime, berry, grape, and a vegan option. According to the website, these capsules never expire. They just need to be kept at room temperature and in a dry place. The pills can be taken with other medications. The cost of encapsulation starts at $500. This never-heard-before ritual has even captured the curiosity of stars like Megan Fox and Vanessa Hudgens , who, like Cardi B, have embraced the trend of creating placenta keepsakes.
Article Summary: The grammy-winning rapper entrusted mommy made encapsulation to transform her pregnancy journey into cherished keepsakes. The company crafted a heart-shaped gold pendant from the baby‚Äôs umbilical cord and turned the placenta into nourishing vitamins to support her post-partum recovery.

Article Title: Stephen Curry‚Äôs frustration over Under Armour‚Äôs missed Caitlin Clark opportunity led to his exit
Article Text:
Caitlin Clark; Stephen Curry (Image via X)

Stephen Curry's frustration with Under Armour's lack of vision

Stephen Curry had been with the sports apparel brand Under Armour for well over a decade. He joined as a brand ambassador in 2013 and was with them until recently, when their partnership ended earlier this month, in November 2025. While the sudden end to this business venture came out of nowhere, slowly, more information is coming to the forefront about what led to Curry's exit.And what might surprise many, is that one of the reasons that led to the end of this partnership was Caitlin Clark. Or more like Under Armour's indecisiveness in landing her as a brand ambassador. The Indiana Fever star was one of the prospects that the brand was looking to land, but they weren't invested enough in the deal, which led to a missed opportunity. And allegedly, Curry thought enough was enough, and decided that it was time his relationship with the brand ended. Stephen Curry , at the end of his partnership with Under Armour, was allegedly unhappy with how the brand was handling things. He had become "frustrated by what they viewed as underinvestment," as well as the lack of sales, as they were not ‚Äúmeeting the company‚Äôs or Curry‚Äôs expectations." With nothing seemingly working out, both parties decided to mutually end the partnership.And another nail in the coffin came in the form of their unsuccessful attempt to recruit Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark to join the brand last year. Both Curry and the company allegedly "pursued the phenom, but Under Armour's offer trailed the total value of Nike's pitch." Clark decided to drop out of the negotiations, and UA did not pursue the WNBA star further either.The Golden State Warriors star had also hoped that Under Armour's founder & CEO Kevin Plank "would invest more in his line,‚Äù but that didn't work out either. But more business is not completely off the books for either party, as UA will ‚Äúdebut the final Curry shoe in February.‚Äù Currently, Curry is like prime real estate, and a lot of brands are looking to snatch him up before the opportunity closes on itself. The GSW star, though, is not in any hurry and is taking his time to decide which way he wants to go.Also Read: ‚ÄúNot your average GOAT‚Äù ‚Äì Stephen Curry unveils new poster of his highly anticipated movie with Ayesha Curry
Article Summary: Stephen curry had been with the sports apparel brand under armour for well over a decade. He joined as a brand ambassador in 2013 and was with them until recently, when their partnership ended earlier this month, in november 2025. Curry had become "frustrated by what they viewed as underinvestment," as well as the lack of sales.

Article Title: Fortnite Updates: Lisa is coming, Release Date, Price, and What to Expect
Article Text:
Image via Fortnite

All details about Lisa's Fortnite Festival debut



Icon Series skins: Three distinct Lisa skins will make their way into Fortnite. Melodie Mars Outfit automatically unlocks by purchasing the pass, whereas the Rockstar LISA Outfit is the final reward of the same. The other LISA Outfit will be available for purchase in the Item Shop.

Item Shop price: The standalone Icon Series outfit is strongly rumored to cost around 2,000 V-Bucks. This specific number is based on pricing for previous Icon Series drops like The Weeknd and Ariana Grande. A complete bundle including additional extras and cosmetics could end up being priced around 2,800 V-Bucks.

New Music Pass: The new Festival Pass will likely cost 1,400 V-Bucks, which is a notable drop from the previous 1,800 V-Bucks passes. It is set to include premium tiers, allowing you to unlock various Lisa-themed items like outfits, dance emotes, and new Jam Tracks.

Custom performance: Lisa‚Äôs avatar will deliver a fully animated concert inside the Festival mode within Fortnite.

Visuals: You can expect a massive, custom stage with highly dynamic lighting, designed specifically for her performance.

Jam Tracks: Tracks include recent hits like "Rockstar," "F*CK UP THE WORLD (Vixi Solo Version)," and "New Woman (ft. Rosalia)." You will be able to unlock these and use them as permanent rewards.

Fans are absolutely buzzing with excitement about the upcoming Fortnite Festival Season 12, as it is set to bring one of the finest crossovers. Essentially, the new season will be headlined by K-pop sensation Lisa, who is quite a prominent name in the music industry.The collaboration was recently confirmed by the developers, with a post being uploaded on the game‚Äôs official social media handles. In the section below, there is a detailed breakdown of what you can expect from the Lisa Fortnite Festival and more.The Fortnite Festival Season 12 is happening on November 29, and this date coincides directly with the launch of the game's Chapter 7 Season 1. Lisa is making history as she is the first solo K-pop artist to ever headline the Fortnite Festival.As part of this crossover, she is also likely to get special in-game skins and other cosmetics. Here is what you can expect:What to expect from Lisa x Fortnite?The biggest buzz is around the in-game Fortnite Festival event, which is set to be a fully animated concert. The following are some of the specifics about the particular experience:This was all you needed to know about Fortnite x Lisa, which is going to be one of the biggest crossovers in recent times.
Article Summary: The fortnite festival season 12 is happening on november 29. It will be headlined by k-pop sensation lisa, who is quite a prominent name in the music industry. Lisa's avatar will deliver a fully animated concert inside the festival mode. The festival pass will likely cost 1,400 v-bucks.

Article Title: Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff says he's never going to use ChatGPT again: ‚ÄòIt feels like the world just changed‚Äô
Article Text:
Tech leaders acknowledge Gemini 3.0 success







Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff has declared that he will not use ChatGPT, the AI chatbot developed by Microsoft-backed AI company OpenAI . His comments came after he used Google‚Äôs latest AI model, Gemini 3.0, stating that a two-hour experience with Google‚Äôs new model has convinced him to switch permanently. Google CEO Sundar Pichai termed the Gemini 3 as the company‚Äôs ‚Äúmost intelligent model, that combines all of Gemini‚Äôs capabilities together so you can bring any idea to life. ‚ÄùIn a post on X, Benioff claimed that Gemini 3.0 has brought a monumental shift in the AI landscape. The CEO specifically praised Gemini 3‚Äôs performance across multiple modalities, noting key improvements in reasoning, speed, image quality, and video processing as the compelling factors behind his decision.‚ÄúHoly shit. I‚Äôve used ChatGPT every day for 3 years. Just spent 2 hours on Gemini 3. I‚Äôm not going back. The leap is insane ‚Äî reasoning, speed, images, video‚Ä¶ everything is sharper and faster. It feels like the world just changed, again. ‚ù§Ô∏è ü§ñ‚ÄùBenioff‚Äôs endorsement highlights the competitive pressure now facing OpenAI as models from rival tech giants like Google make significant advances. Tesla CEO Elon Musk and even OpenAI chief executive Sam Altman praised Pichai following the launch of Gemini 3.The xAI founder said ‚ÄúCongrats‚Äù on Pichai‚Äôs "Geminiii" announcement on X, and ‚ÄúNice Work‚Äù to Demis Hassabis, the chief of DeepMind. Altman posted ‚ÄúCongrats to Google on Gemini 3! Looks like a great model.‚ÄùAltman even noted potential ‚Äútemporary economic headwinds‚Äù in an internal memo but expressed confidence in OpenAl‚Äôs rapid progress and leadership in the Al race.‚ÄúWe have built enough strength as a company to weather great models shipping elsewhere competition... (so), having most of our research team focused on really getting to superintelligence is critically important,‚Äù Altman wrote.
Article Summary: Salesforce ceo mark benioff has declared that he will not use chatgpt, the ai chatbot developed by microsoft-backed ai company openai. His comments came after he used google‚Äôs latest ai model, gemini 3.0, stating that a two-hour experience with the model has convinced him to switch permanently.

Article Title: OnePlus 15R and OnePlus Pad Go 2 to launch in India on December 17: What to expect
Article Text:
OnePlus 15R to come with IP66, IP68, IP69, and IP68K durability ratings

OnePlus Pad Go 2 to come with 5G connectivity and stylus support





OnePlus will launch its latest flagship series smartphone and mid-range tablet‚ÄîOnePlus 15R and OnePlus Pad 2 Go‚Äîin India on December 17, the company announced. The OnePlus 15R, a more affordable counterpart of the company's flagship OnePlus 15, is said bring bring out-and-out durability ratings, featuring four IP certifications. Meanwhile, the OnePlus Pad 2 Go is said to bring 5G and OnePlus Stylo stylus support, a first for company's Go line of tablets. Here‚Äôs everything we know about the two upcoming OnePlus devices‚ÄîOnePlus 15R and OnePlus Pad 2 Go‚Äîlaunching next month.OnePlus is promising ‚Äúindustry‚Äôs most complete durability ratings‚Äù with the OnePlus 15R. The smartphone is being certified with IP66, IP68, IP69, and IP69K ratings. The company also confirmed that OnePlus 15R will feature a redesigned camera module, angled at 45 degrees from the top-left corner and a flat metal mid-frame, which promises protection against extreme conditions. The OnePlus 15R will come in two colours: Charcoal Black and Mint Breeze.While OnePlus hasn't revealed full specifications yet, rumours suggest the 15R could pack Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 chipset with a 7800mAh or even bigger capacity battery. The smartphone may also feature a 165Hz display and 100W fast charging.The OnePlus Pad Go 2 introduces 5G connectivity to the Pad Go series for the first time, available on the Shadow Black variant.Indian consumers can also opt for Lavender Drift, both finished with a skin-friendly texture.The tablet's standout feature is the OnePlus Pad Go 2 Stylo‚Äîthe series' first integrated stylus designed for note-taking and creative work. The company is positioning the device as an option for students and professionals seeking affordable productivity tools in India's growing tablet market.OnePlus will reveal complete specifications, features, and Indian pricing in the weeks leading up to the December 17 launch event. The OnePlus 15R and OnePlus Pad Go 2 will go on sale in India alongside Europe and North America.
Article Summary: Oneplus 15r to come with ip66, ip68, ip69, and ip68k durability ratings. Oneplus pad go 2 will come with 5g connectivity and stylus support. Both devices will go on sale in india alongside europe and north america.

Article Title: How to restore old photos with Google Nano Banana Pro: A prompt guide and expert tips
Article Text:
Why Google Nano Banana Pro is ideal for restoring old photos

Google‚Äôs New AI Is BANANAS: How To Use Gemini Nano Banana

How to use Google Nano Banana Pro to restore old photos with the right prompts

General restoration prompt:

Portrait restoration prompt:

Colour correction prompt:

Severely damaged photo prompt:

Tips to restore old photos with Google Nano Banana Pro without losing authenticity

Avoid over-enhancing

Check historical colour references

Preserve original shadows

Inspect edges and background details

Common mistakes when restoring old photos with Google Nano Banana Pro

Also read|





There is something magical about rediscovering an old, worn photograph. The soft yellows, the creases, the fading edges and the stubborn scratches hold stories that feel too precious to lose. Until recently, restoring these photos required hours of painstaking manual editing. Now Google Nano Banana Pro has made that process far easier. With the right prompts and a bit of creative direction, you can revive portraits, repair damage, and bring lost details back to life in a way that looks natural and polished. Whether you are working with a family album or a treasured vintage snapshot, this tool gives you professional level results with far less effort.Google Nano Banana Pro uses advanced diffusion modelling and context-aware reconstruction. In simple terms, it analyses each pixel, predicts missing details and rebuilds textures so the restored image looks authentic rather than overly sharpened. It also understands lighting, skin tones, shadows and colour balance, which makes it one of the most reliable tools for repairing vintage portraits. Instead of plastic-looking edits, you get subtle, human-like restoration that respects the original photo.The model also handles very damaged images. Torn edges, fold marks, grainy patches and faded backgrounds can be reconstructed automatically. For photos from the 70s and 80s, which often have tinted colour casts, the tool balances hues without making the image look artificial.Using this model effectively comes down to guiding it with clear prompts. Here are prompt structures that work well for damaged or faded photos:‚ÄúRestore this old photograph with natural colours, clean details and accurate lighting. Remove scratches, stains and noise while keeping the original style.‚Äù‚ÄúReconstruct the face gently, retain natural skin texture, preserve original expressions and repair damaged areas without over-smoothing.‚Äù‚ÄúNeutralise yellow tint, improve contrast, balance highlights and shadows, and restore film-like tones.‚Äù‚ÄúRebuild missing or torn sections, reconstruct textures, recover facial features accurately and maintain the vintage feel of the image.‚ÄùYou can also add extra artistic instructions such as ‚Äúkeep grain minimal‚Äù or ‚Äúretain film quality‚Äù. The more specific you are, the more consistent the results.To ensure your restored photos look natural, keep these expert guidelines in mind:It is tempting to eliminate all grain, but older photographs naturally have texture. Leave a little grain to maintain the vintage character.For very old family photographs, match the restored colours with reference images from that era. For example, mid-century colour palettes often used softer reds and muted greens.Shadows anchor a photograph. If you remove too many shadows or highlights, the restored image may look flat. Let the model repair damage, but keep the original lighting structure intact.While the model handles most reconstruction automatically, sometimes background objects can appear too clean. Adjusting the prompt to ‚Äúpreserve background imperfections‚Äù can solve this.Many beginners make the error of giving vague prompts like ‚Äúfix this photo‚Äù. This causes incorrect smoothing, unnatural facial features or oddly bright colours. Another mistake is using portrait prompts for landscape images, which can distort objects. Over-sharpening is also common, resulting in a digital rather than vintage look. Always compare the original and restored versions side by side to ensure the emotional tone remains the same.Photo restoration is more than fixing pixels. It is a way of honouring memories that might otherwise fade. With Google Nano Banana Pro and the right prompt strategy, you can bring old pictures back to life while preserving their history and charm. A few careful edits and a well-structured prompt are often all it takes to rebuild details, refresh colours and revive treasured moments. If you have a box of old photographs waiting to be restored, this tool is a gentle and precise way to begin.
Article Summary: Google nano banana pro uses advanced diffusion modelling and context-aware reconstruction. It analyses each pixel, predicts missing details and rebuilds textures so the restored image looks authentic rather than overly sharpened. For photos from the 70s and 80s which often have tinted colour casts, the tool balances hues without making the image look artificial.

Article Title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon calls Nvidia an 'unbelievable‚Äô company, but warns some people will ‚Ä¶
Article Text:
AI is real and not a passing trend

Nvidia‚Äôs historic milestone



JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon doesn‚Äôt sugarcoat AI impact on jobs





JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has now hailed Nvidia as an unbelievable company and has also cautioned investors that some artificial intelligence stocks may be trading at an unsustainable levels. Speaking with CNN‚Äôs Erin Burnett, Dimon said that the US remains the ‚Äòmost prosperous‚Äô economy in the world. He adds that the US economy is supported by diverse and deep capital markets including venture capital, private credit and hedge funds. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no question some people will lose money,‚Äù Dimon said, drawing parallels to the dot-com era. ‚ÄúBut mankind should benefit,‚Äù he added, emphasising that the underlying technology is real and transformative‚Äîeven if valuations are currently inflated.Dimon emphasized that AI is a genuine productivity revolution, comparing its current stage to the early days of the Internet. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs almost at the beginning,‚Äù he said, noting that while not every company will succeed, AI will produce transformative winners just as the internet gave rise to Google, Facebook, and Amazon.Dimon acknowledged that valuations in the AI sector may be inflated, but stressed that the underlying technology will reshape industries and improve lives.‚ÄúMankind should benefit,‚Äù he said, even if ‚Äúvaluations today may be too high for some of these folks.‚ÄùIn October 2025, Nvidia became the first company in history to surpass a $5 trillion market valuation. Its market cap currently stands at $4.74 trillion, underscoring its dominance in the AI chip market. Dimon‚Äôs remarks came shortly after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang predicted that China will win the AI race, a claim that drew sharp pushback from President Donald Trump, who vowed the U.S. would not allow other nations access to Nvidia‚Äôs most advanced chips.In another interview with Bloomberg TV, Dimon talked about the impact of AI on the job market. ‚ÄúPeople shouldn‚Äôt put their head in the sand. It is going to affect jobs,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAI will enhance some aspects of work, but also eliminate some jobs.‚Äù However, Dimon also stressed on the fact that JPMorgan is focused on retaining and redeploying employees whose roles are impacted by automation. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll have more jobs, but there‚Äôll probably be less jobs in certain functions,‚Äù Dimon added. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre better off being way ahead of the curve,‚Äù Dimon added.Dimon also added that the bank has invested about $2 billion as an annual investment in AI and is already making $2 billion in direct benefits. This includes the headcount reductions and operational savings. ‚ÄúWe know about $2 billion of actual cost saves,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the tip of the iceberg.‚Äù
Article Summary: Jpmorgan chase ceo jamie dimon has hailed nvidia as an unbelievable company. He has also cautioned investors that some artificial intelligence stocks may be trading at an unsustainable levels. Dimon emphasized that ai is a genuine productivity revolution, comparing its current stage to the early days of the internet.

Unlike standard word games, players must detect subtle links between words, which can range from obvious to highly nuanced or abstract. The game is freely available on mobile devices and desktop platforms, allowing enthusiasts to play anytime, anywhere, at their convenience.Its combination of easy-to-understand mechanics, challenging puzzles, and complex problem-solving has turned it into a daily ritual for many. Identify patterns or associations to sort them into four correct categories.Yes, the game provides subtle hints to guide players without revealing the answers outright.Yes, it is available for free on both mobile devices and desktop platforms.It sharpens pattern recognition, logical thinking, lateral reasoning, and problem-solving skills.

Article Title: Warren Buffett‚Äôs $4.3 billion Alphabet investment signals a direct challenge to Nvidia‚Äôs lead in AI chips
Article Text:
Google‚Äôs AI chips may be shifting the balance of power

Nvidia Makes History: First Company to Hit $4 Trillion Market Cap

A shifting competitive dynamic, but not a dethroning

Google trains and serves Gemini models on TPU infrastructure.

Google Cloud is offering Ironwood TPUs to customers as part of its cloud platform.

Companies such as Anthropic have announced plans to use up to one million Google TPUs, citing performance and cost considerations.

What Buffett‚Äôs investment likely signals

Implications for the AI chip race





When Berkshire Hathaway revealed a new multibillion-dollar stake in Alphabet, most observers initially viewed it as another major addition to Warren Buffett‚Äôs long-term portfolio. Yet the timing and strategic context suggest the investment could be more than a routine allocation. The world‚Äôs most influential value investor has chosen to back Alphabet at a moment when the company is strengthening its control over the hardware that underpins advanced AI systems.For nearly a decade, Alphabet has been developing its own artificial intelligence chips, known as Tensor Processing Units (TPUs). In November 2025, the company announced general availability of its seventh-generation Ironwood TPU, describing it as designed for demanding AI workloads, including large-scale model training and high-volume inference. This announcement was made publicly on Google Cloud‚Äôs official blog, where the company highlighted lower costs and improved performance for AI developers.Most AI labs still rely heavily on Nvidia‚Äôs high-performance GPUs.These GPUs remain the industry‚Äôs gold standard, but they are extremely expensive and often in short supply. This has created bottlenecks for AI companies that depend entirely on Nvidia for compute capacity.Google is in a unique position. By designing its own chips, running its own data centres and integrating its hardware into products such as Gemini and Google Cloud, Alphabet gains levels of efficiency that many competitors cannot match without years of hardware investment. Analysts and industry researchers have suggested that TPU-based training may offer meaningful cost advantages compared to traditional GPU-heavy infrastructure, although exact ratios vary and are not always publicly disclosed.Buffett‚Äôs investment therefore can be understood not as a claim that Alphabet has overtaken Nvidia, but as confidence in Alphabet‚Äôs vertically integrated approach to AI. By controlling more of the stack, Alphabet potentially insulates itself from the price swings, supply constraints and dependence that characterise the GPU market.Nvidia remains the clear leader in AI chips and maintains a robust ecosystem of developers, tools and software support. Google‚Äôs TPUs represent a serious alternative in some workloads, but not a full replacement for GPUs across all use cases.The publicly available evidence shows:These developments suggest that the AI compute market may become more competitive. However, they do not confirm that Nvidia‚Äôs dominance is definitively weakened. Instead, they indicate that Alphabet is emerging as a strong hardware contender in a market previously dominated by a single supplier.Berkshire Hathaway‚Äôs disclosed stake in Alphabet was valued at approximately US$4.3 billion at the time of the filing. The filing does not state Berkshire‚Äôs motives. However, investors and analysts widely agree that Buffett‚Äôs approval of such a large position indicates confidence in Alphabet‚Äôs long-term strategy, including its growing emphasis on efficient AI infrastructure.Buffett has consistently favoured companies with durable advantages or ‚Äúmoats.‚Äù Alphabet‚Äôs traditional moats have included Search, YouTube and Android. In the AI era, Google‚Äôs control over its own chip design and cloud hardware may represent an additional moat that differentiates it from rivals.This does not imply that Google is attempting to dismantle Nvidia‚Äôs leadership. Instead, it suggests that Alphabet is building the capability to operate more independently in an AI-driven future, and that this capability may strengthen its competitiveness in cloud computing and AI services.The next phase of AI is likely to be shaped by which companies can train and deploy models most efficiently. If Google Cloud attracts more third-party training due to cost, performance and availability, it could gradually shift cloud market dynamics. Nvidia will remain central to the ecosystem, but Google‚Äôs TPU ecosystem adds a new dimension to the competition.Buffett‚Äôs investment amplifies the narrative that companies with deeper control over hardware, software and data will hold significant advantages in the years ahead. Alphabet is signalling that it intends to be such a company.The takeaway is clear: this is not the end of Nvidia‚Äôs dominance, but it may be the beginning of a more competitive era in AI hardware.
Article Summary: Berkshire hathaway revealed a new multibillion-dollar stake in alphabet. The timing and strategic context suggest the investment could be more than a routine allocation. The world‚Äôs most influential value investor has chosen to back alphabet at a moment when the company is strengthening its control over the hardware that underpins advanced ai systems.

Article Title: Apple CEO Tim Cook may not be retiring soon, here‚Äôs why
Article Text:
Apple CEO Tim Cook Confirms Majority Of iPhones Sold In U.S. Now Made In India

Tim Cook to reportedly retire in 2026

Tim Cook‚Äôs continued leadership

What‚Äôs next for Apple‚Äôs executive team





Apple CEO Tim Cook may not be retiring anytime soon. Earlier this month, a report by Financial Times revealed that Tim Cook is planning to step down as soon as next year. However, a new report by Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman suggests that Cook has no plans of stepping down in the near future. Apple has been preparing for a leadership transition for quite some time. In 2024, Bloomberg revealed that Apple‚Äôs senior vice president of hardware engineering John Ternus was at the center of succession discussions. Ternus the youngest member of Apple‚Äôs executive team looks after the hardware division and is also widely respected by Apple CEO Tim Cook and former COO Jeff Williams.Then in October this year, Bloomberg suggests that the internal spotlight on Ternus was ‚Äòintensifying‚Äô, making him the likely candidate to succeed Cook.Earlier this month, a report by Financial Times revealed that Apple CEO Tim Cook may step down from his position in between January and June 2026. As per the report, the current CEO Tim Cook is said to be succeeded by John Ternus, Apple‚Äôs senior vice-president of hardware engineering. However, no final decision has been made, sources told the publication. They also stressed that the transition plans are not tied to Apple‚Äôs current performance, as the company heads into what is expected to be a strong holiday season for iPhone sales.Taking about this upcoming transition, Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman wrote, ‚ÄúBased on everything I‚Äôve learned in recent weeks, I don‚Äôt believe a departure by the middle of next year is likely.‚Äù This means there are less chances of Tim Cook retiring anytime soon.Cook, who turned 65 this month, took over as CEO in 2011 after co-founder Steve Jobs died. Under his leadership, Apple‚Äôs valuation has climbed from around $350 billion to $4 trillion. Despite strong results last month, Apple‚Äôs roughly 12% stock rise this year trails rivals like Alphabet, Nvidia and Microsoft, which have surged on AI momentum.‚ÄúYes, Apple will eventually have a new leader. And, yes, it‚Äôs probably Ternus. But unless there is some unexpected event that forces Cook to step down sooner than planned, that moment is not at hand. But there still may be significant movement on Apple‚Äôs executive team. As I recently reported, silicon chief Johny Srouji is seriously evaluating his future at the company, while Apple has been on the hunt for a new AI leader,‚Äù said Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman.While the retirement of Apple CEO Tim Cook is not imminent, Bloomberg reveals that the company will still witness some leadership changes in the coming weeks. As per the report,Apple‚Äôs silicon chief, Johny Srouji may be evaluating his future at the company. Also, Apple is actively looking for a new AI leader in order to strengthen its position in generative AI sector.
Article Summary: Earlier this month, a report by financial times revealed that tim cook is planning to step down as soon as next year. However, a new report by bloomberg‚Äôs mark gurman suggests that cook has no plans of stepping down in the near future.

Article Title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos warns of possible Recession; advises what to bring off the table
Article Text:
Bezos‚Äô broader outlook





Mayhem at Amazon Amid 30,000 Job Cuts: AI - Easy Corporate Excuse? | Global Pulse

Impact on Amazon





AI-Powered Future: Next Gen Careers You Should Watch

Moody's warns that many US States showing recession signs





Amazon founder Jeff Bezos has once again issued one of his starkest warnings yet about the global economy. Bezos has urged the consumers and businesses to postpone their large purchases as the fear of recession is mounting. Speaking to CNN‚Äôs Chole Melas in an interview, Bezos has cautioned that the coming months could bring prolonged downturn. Bezos has recommend that households should consider putting a hold on purchasing big-ticket products such as cars, televisions and appliances. He urge the consumers to save that money as it will make a lot of difference if the economic worsens. Along with this, Bezos has also advised the small businesses to avoid large capital expenditures or acquisitions during this uncertain period.‚ÄúTake some risk off the table,‚Äù Bezos said. ‚ÄúJust a little bit of risk reduction could make the difference.‚ÄùDespite his cautionary advice, Bezos struck an optimistic tone about the long-term future, saying he believes the American Dream remains attainable. He even projected that within his lifetime, space travel could become broadly accessible to the public. Last month, Bezos tweeted a warning to ‚Äúbatten down the hatches,‚Äù advice he reiterated in his CNN interview as relevant to both consumers and business owners.Ironically, if the consumers follow Bezos‚Äô advice, then it could mean lower sales for Amazon. Recently, Amazon announced its plans to layoff 14,000 employees. In October, Amazon projected holiday-quarter sales below Wall Street expectations, citing inflation and shifting consumer behavior. Americans are spending more on travel and dining out and less on discretionary goods.Recently, Mark Zandi, chief economist at credit rating agency Moody' warned about recession in the US. A new analysis of state-level data suggests that the US economy is "on the edge of recession," said Mark Zandi of Moody's. "Based on my assessment of various data, states making up nearly a third of US GDP are either in or at high risk of recession, another third are just holding steady, and the remaining third are growing," Zandi wrote on social media.The data reveals a mixed picture across the country. States in the South are generally the strongest, though their growth is beginning to slow. Meanwhile, some of the nation's largest economies, like California and New York, are described as "holding their own," and their stability is seen as critical to preventing a full-blown national recession.However, many states are showing signs of vulnerability. Wyoming, Montana, Minnesota, Mississippi, Kansas, and Massachusetts were all identified as being at high risk of recession. The broader Washington, D.C. area is also notable for its economic struggles, which Zandi attributes to government job cuts.Adding to the forecast, Zandi predicts that the annual inflation rate, currently at 2.7%, could rise to nearly 4% within the next year, further eroding purchasing power for consumers.Along with this, Zandi also warned about the restrictive immigration policies which could hurt the tech sector. He urged the lawmakers to protect access to global talent especially in AI, software engineering, and data science. "If it feels like we're coming to the end of the tariff increases, or like we're going to get a more rational immigration policy,' I think that would be a signal that the coast may be cleared," Zandi told BI.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs no mystery why the economy is struggling; blame increasing U.S. tariffs and highly restrictive immigration policy. The tariffs are cutting increasingly deeply into the profits of American companies and the purchasing power of American households. Fewer immigrant workers means a smaller economy,‚Äù added Zandi.
Article Summary: Bezos has urged the consumers and businesses to postpone their large purchases as the fear of recession is mounting. Recently, amazon announced its plans to layoff 14,000 employees. In october, amazon projected holiday-quarter sales below wall street expectations, citing inflation and shifting consumer behavior.

Article Title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google‚Äôs AI success can create‚Ä¶
Article Text:
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential temporary economic challenges but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman remains optimistic about the company's long-term vision for superintelligence and its strategic partnerships, including one with Foxconn to bolster US AI infrastructure.

"create some temporary economic headwinds for our company."

"catching up fast"

What Sam Altman said OpenAI employees about the company‚Äôs biggest rivals

OpenAI's Master Plan for India

‚ÄúWe have built enough strength as a company to weather great models shipping elsewhere competition... (so), having most of our research team focused on really getting to superintelligence is critically important,‚Äù

‚ÄúIt s**ks that we have to do so many hard things at the same time ‚Äî the best research lab, the best AI infrastructure company, and the best AI platform/product company ‚Äî but such is our lot in life. And I wouldn't trade positions with any other company,‚Äù

‚ÄúThis partnership is a step toward ensuring the core technologies of the AI era are built here [US],‚Äù and added that AI infrastructure production presents a

‚Äúgenerational opportunity to reindustrialise America.‚Äù

"is uniquely positioned to support OpenAI‚Äôs mission with trusted, scalable infrastructure."

"Congrats to Google on Gemini 3! Looks like a great model," he said after the launch. Pichai replied with 'folded hands' emoji.





ChatGPT maker OpenAI 's CEO Sam Altman is optimistic about Google 's recent successes in artificial intelligence (AI) technology. In a recent internal memo to colleagues, Altman acknowledged that the AI startup rival's success couldHowever, Altman reassured that OpenAI isand anticipates emerging as the leader in the AI race. It's important to note that Altman's memo was written before Google's Gemini 3 was released, a model the tech giant has described as its most capable to date. Software developers have reported that the new model performed well on tasks such as automating website and product design and writing code, which is a lucrative revenue stream for OpenAI and its competitors, such as Anthropic.Concerns about OpenAI's slowing growth arose late this summer. During a recent quarterly earnings call with investors, the company‚Äôs CFO, Sarah Friar, confirmed that user engagement with the popular AI chatbot ChatGPT had cooled, despite the company's otherwise positive financial results.According to a report by The Information (as seen by The Economic Times), Sam Altman's memo noted that competitors such as Google and Anthropic are narrowing the gap in the AI raceAnthropic‚Äôs Claude model generates computer code for various tasks using conversational prompts.Meanwhile, Google has been integrating its Gemini AI chatbot into its search app, productivity tools and other services. However, recently, Claude gained a new challenger from OpenAI with the introduction of Codex.Google also holds an economic advantage. OpenAI‚Äôs growth has been rapid and the company now carries a valuation of around $500 billion as a for-profit entity. It is expected to bring in about $13 billion in revenue, but is estimated to burn roughly $100 billion in its push toward superintelligence.With a market value of about $3.5 trillion, Google reported free cash flow of over $70 billion in the past four quarters. A significant portion of this comes from providing cloud services to OpenAI, Anthropic and other competitors.Sam Altman also encouraged OpenAI employees to stay confident and focus on the company's larger goals.Altman wrote in the internal memo.Altman added.Recently, OpenAI partnered with Apple's biggest suuplier Foxconn to design and build AI data-centre components in the US. Under this partnership, OpenAI will help develop future server systems and may purchase Foxconn-produced hardware in the coming days. Altman noted that this collaboration can strengthen American manufacturing infrastructure.Commenting on the partnership, Altman said:Foxconn will join OpenAI‚Äôs supply chain to manufacture AI-related hardware in a more American way. The company, known for iPhone assembly, also manufactures AI servers and supplies components to Nvidia.Commenting on the partnership, Foxconn chairman Young Liu said that the company
Article Summary: Openai ceo sam altman acknowledges google's ai advancements, noting potential temporary economic challenges but expressing confidence in openai's rapid progress. Despite concerns about slowing chatgpt engagement, altman remains optimistic about the company's long-term vision for superintelligence.

Article Title: Greenex environmental and Norway‚Äôs EPD global sign a memorandum of understanding
Article Text: PUNE: City-based Greenex Environmental has signed a strategic international collaboration agreement with Norway-based EPD Global to offer services in the area of publishing Environmental Product Declarations (EPD). The announcement was made by Sagar Ahiwale and Arati Bhosale-Ahiwale, joint Managing Directors of the company, at a news conference held on Monday, Nov 24, after signing a Memorandum of Understanding with Mr. H√•kon Hauan, CEO of The Norwegian EPD Foundation (EPD-Norway).The MoU provides for assessment by Greenex Environmental of the environmental impact on products manufactured by Indian businesses and the issuance of an Environmental Product Declaration for each product by the Norwegian collaborator. EPD certification is required for all manufacturers. Through this exclusive partnership, the two organizations will collaborate to deliver high-quality EPD services to Indian and regional manufacturers. The collaboration aims to enable industries, especially MSMEs and large manufacturing sectors, to enhance their sustainability performance, improve transparency, and meet international market requirements.With the combined strengths of EPD Global‚Äôs publication authority and Greenex‚Äôs deep technical capabilities, manufacturers will now have easier access to world-class support for developing and publishing EPDs.India has been performing strongly in the world market, with MSMEs being the backbone of the country‚Äôs exports. There is a rising trend in the world market to give preference to the products that hold EPDs. Indian SMEs will benefit greatly from EPDs for their products as the buyer will prefer to import such products and may offer a higher price, Aarati Bhosale-Ahiwale said.‚ÄúGovernments all over the world are insisting on a reduction in the environmental impact of products and services. Though not mandatory at the moment, EPDs will become the norm in the days to come. Greenex has been in the EPD business for the last few years and has so far worked with more than 50 businesses across industries such as chemicals, engineering, metals, and food", Ahiwale said.‚ÄúThe collaboration with EPD Global, Norway, will help raise the quality of EPDs to international standards and reduce the cost of obtaining the certification by about 70 per cent,‚Äù she added.Sagar Ahiwale said the initiative marks a significant milestone for the sustainability domain in India and beyond. It is expected to create new employment opportunities, strengthen industry competitiveness, and accelerate the adoption of environmentally responsible practices. ‚ÄúThe collaboration is a major step forward in helping organisations transition towards low-carbon, globally compliant operations,‚Äù he added.‚ÄúThe partnership will play a significant role in sustainability and also contribute to India's efforts to achieve a Net-Zero environmental impact by 2070,‚Äù Ahiwale said. The company currently has offices in Pune, Mumbai, Gujarat, as well as Dubai, and intends to open new offices in India in major industry centres,‚Äù he said.
Article Summary: Greenex environmental has signed a strategic international collaboration agreement with norway-based epd global. The two organizations will collaborate to deliver high-quality epd services to indian and regional manufacturers. The mou provides for assessment by greenex environmental of the environmental impact on products manufactured by indian businesses.

Article Title: GCWCN 2025 showcases breakthrough innovations across AI, quantum computing, IoT & healthcare engineering
Article Text: PUNE: The Global Conference on Wireless, Computing & Networking (GCWCN 2025), held on November 22‚Äì23, 2025, at the Corporate Training Center (CTC), STES‚Äôs Campus, Sinhgad Institute of Technology, Kusgaon (Bk), Lonavala, concluded with remarkable participation from researchers, academicians, and technology leaders from across the globe. Organized in hybrid mode, the event provided an impactful platform for discussing emerging trends shaping next-generation intelligent systems with keynote sessions by Nagarjuna Nellutla , Site Reliability Engineer , USA and Balaji Krishnan Senior Technical Architect at Salesforce.com , USA.This year, the conference witnessed an overwhelming response, with 1312 of paper submissions from researchers worldwide. Out of these, a select number were shortlisted and presented across multiple technical tracks. In a highly anticipated valedictory session, five exceptional papers were spotlighted for their exemplary contributions to advancing technology, innovation, and applied research across domains such as AI, cybersecurity, IoT, and healthcare engineering, a statement issued by the organisers said.In the Computing Technologies track, the paper ‚ÄúNeuromorphic LLM Pipelines for Adaptive Big Data Governance Across Distributed Cloud Providers‚Äù by Nirmal Sajanraj, Sarvesh Peddi, Ashok Ghimire, and Pankaj Kumar Tejraj Jain was recognized for its groundbreaking approach to neuromorphic-LLM‚Äìdriven cloud governance.Their work introduces an adaptive big data architecture designed for resilient, intelligent policy automation across distributed cloud ecosystems.In the Cybersecurity & Quantum Computing track, Sooraj George Thomas presented the paper ‚ÄúQuantum-Federated Threat Detection in Multi-Cloud Data Lakes: A Zero-Trust Security Approach,‚Äù which impressed the review committee with its integration of quantum-resilient models and federated data processing. The proposed zero-trust architecture enhances threat detection capabilities across multi-cloud environments.The Secure AI & Distributed Learning track highlighted the contribution of Priya Ranjan Kumar, Balaje Prasath Manoharan, and Piyush Ranjan for their paper ‚ÄúQuantum-Federated Learning for Cybersecurity: Secure Threat Detection and Response Using Multi-Cloud Data Lakes.‚Äù Their federated learning framework improves cybersecurity readiness while preserving data sovereignty across distributed cloud platforms.In the IoT & Edge Intelligence track, the work ‚ÄúRAG-Driven IoT Sensor Analytics: Real-Time Data Engineering for Predictive Maintenance in Hybrid Cloud Environments‚Äù by Hemant Soni, Balakumar Ravindranath Kunthu, Tarun Vishwanath Chincholi, and Rishiraj Kohli stood out for introducing a retrieval-augmented IoT sensor analytics pipeline enabling precise predictive maintenance across hybrid cloud infrastructures.Rounding off the event, the Healthcare AI & Biomedical Engineering track featured Sai Pavan Veluguri, whose paper ‚ÄúAI-Enhanced Multimodal Framework for Early Diagnosis of Neuro-Cardiac Disorders‚Äù was recognized for its transformative potential in medical diagnostics. The research integrates multimodal biosignals with AI-driven analysis to support early detection and clinical decision-making for neuro-cardiac disorders.The organizing committee highlighted that GCWCN 2025 demonstrated the region‚Äôs growing prominence as a hub for technology innovation, fostering global collaboration and offering a strong platform for knowledge exchange.
Article Summary: The global conference on wireless, computing & networking (gcwcn 2025), held on november 22‚Äì23, 2025, at the corporate training center (ctc), stes‚Äôs campus, sinhgad institute of technology, kusgaon (bk), lonavala. The event provided an impactful platform for discussing emerging trends shaping next-generation intelligent systems.

Article Title: YouTuber WhistlinDiesel Cody Detwiler reveals the surprise truth behind his tax evasion arrest over the Ferrari F8
Article Text:
YouTuber WhistlinDiesel Cody Detwiler reveals the surprise truth behind his tax evasion arrest over the Ferrari F8 (Image via Getty)

Why Cody ‚ÄúWhistlinDiesel‚Äù says he was arrested for not paying sales tax on his Ferrari F8

I Got Arrested for "Tax Evasion"





Cody ‚ÄúWhistlinDiesel,‚Äù a very popular YouTuber, says he was arrested for tax evasion because he did not pay sales tax on his $400,000 Ferrari F8. He told this in a new video on November 23, 2025, on his YouTube channel. The video is titled I Got Arrested for ‚ÄúTax Evasion.‚Äù In the video, at the 10-minute-52-second mark, he says he owed about $30,000 in sales tax for the Ferrari. He also says the car is not even alive anymore, because it burned and got smashed into a cube.He says the Ferrari got destroyed in August 2023 after he drove it through a cornfield. Cody says he never got any letter or notice saying he must pay this tax. He says the car was titled in Montana, where people do not pay sales tax when a business owns the car. Cody says many luxury car owners do the same thing.At 10:52 in the video, Cody ‚ÄúWhistlinDiesel‚Äù explains that the Ferrari F8 was titled and registered in Montana. He says Montana does not ask for sales tax if a business owns the car. Cody says many luxury car owners use Montana because it helps them save money on tax.He says that ‚Äú85% of luxury car owners‚Äù have a business in Montana to hold their cars. He says the Ferrari had a clean Montana title and that he thought this was normal because many other people also do it.Cody also says the Ferrari caught fire in Texas, not in Tennessee. So he was surprised when he was told he owed tax in Tennessee. He says the car ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù anymore because it burned and then was crushed into a cube.At the 15-minute mark of the video, WhistlinDiesel says he believes the officers ‚Äúwent after him‚Äù because he is a big name online. He says they thought arresting him would scare other car owners who also use Montana registration. He says the officers wanted people to switch their car papers back to their home states and pay the tax there.WhistlinDiesel says he has a wife and kids, and the arrest scared him. He says he does not want to go to prison. He also says he now wants to buy land in Montana so he can build his business there and avoid problems like this in the future.Also Read: Is Laura Loomer Pregnant With Ian Miles Cheong‚Äôs Child? Viral X Rumor Shocks Fans As Podcaster Breaks The Truth
Article Summary: Cody ‚Äúwhistlindiesel‚Äù says he was arrested for not paying sales tax on his ferrari f8. He says the car was titled in montana, where people do not pay sales tax when a business owns the car. Cody says many luxury car owners use montana because it helps them save money on tax.

Article Title: Saudi Arabia quietly lets expats buy alcohol in Riyadh stores
Article Text:
Expats in Saudi Arabia can now quietly buy alcohol in Riyadh, signaling cautious policy change/Representative Image

Alcohol access



Trump Sparks Global Fury With 'Things Happen' Defence of Saudi Crown Prince In Khashoggi Murder Case

Vision 2030

Residency program





Saudi Arabia has taken a cautious step in loosening its long-standing restrictions on alcohol, allowing non-Muslim residents under the country‚Äôs special residency program to purchase alcohol from Riyadh stores that were previously reserved for diplomats. The move is part of the kingdom‚Äôs broader effort to boost tourism and diversify its economy under Vision 2030.According to Semafor, the Saudi government has quietly expanded access, permitting non-Muslim holders of the premium residency program to buy alcohol from the Riyadh store, which until now catered exclusively to foreign diplomats. The government has not issued an official announcement; the change became known as residents discovered it while attempting to purchase alcohol.This initiative aligns with Saudi Arabia‚Äôs Vision 2030 plan, which aims to attract 150 million visitors annually and reduce reliance on oil revenues. The Riyadh liquor store, opened last year, centralized alcohol distribution in the kingdom, which previously relied on diplomatic shipments.Launched in 2019, the premium residency program targets high-earning expatriates and skilled foreign workers. By allowing this group to buy alcohol, the government signals openness to expatriates while maintaining strict overall control over alcohol sales. Eligibility for the program has expanded over time and now includes expatriates earning more than 80,000 riyals ($21,000) per month or those employed in certain professions.Historically, alcohol has been strictly prohibited in Saudi Arabia, though some hotels offer mocktails and non-alcoholic beer. Businesses are prepared to adapt to the new regulations, but the government is proceeding cautiously.
Article Summary: Expats in saudi arabia can now quietly buy alcohol in riyadh, signaling cautious policy change. Eligibility for the program has expanded over time and now includes expatriates earning more than 80,000 riyals ($21,000) per month or those employed in certain professions.
